App.LicenseClient

Class Verifications

  • java.lang.Object
    • App.LicenseClient.Base
      • App.LicenseClient.Verifications

  • class Verifications
extends Base
    Verifications class helps in verifying all checks before every time the application is started to ensure and start the correct version of the application (demo or full mode)

      private java.util.List<byte[]> list

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) java.lang.String dContent(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String keyFile)
      if dContent has the hard coded value as output then digital sign is wrong and not validated but still we can understand this is the case as hardcode value is false only if the verification fails
      private java.security.PublicKey getPublic(java.lang.String filename) 
      boolean verify(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String keyFile)
      The Verify method retrieves the byte arrays from the File and returns TRUE only if the signature is verified.
      (package private) boolean verifyK()
      verifyK method helps to verify if the 3 types of key value generated before and after activation request is the same data or not.
      (package private) boolean verifyPnPmData()
      verifyPnPmData method is one of the 3 levels of verification done , it basically checks the value created using encryption for machine ID using that specific key is same as the data created with same key after Activation key is passed on to user.
      private boolean verifySignature(byte[] data, byte[] signature, java.lang.String keyFile)
      verifySignature method helps check the digital signature verification on each run of the application.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(java.lang.String filename,
                      java.lang.String keyFile)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        The Verify method retrieves the byte arrays from the File and returns TRUE only if the signature is verified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • dContent

        java.lang.String dContent(java.lang.String filename,
                          java.lang.String keyFile)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        if dContent has the hard coded value as output then digital sign is wrong and not validated but still we can understand this is the case as hardcode value is false only if the verification fails
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • verifySignature

        private boolean verifySignature(byte[] data,
                                byte[] signature,
                                java.lang.String keyFile)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        verifySignature method helps check the digital signature verification on each run of the application. Need files of specific type as inputs in specific folders
        Parameters:
        data - value from byte array
        signature - data from byte array
        keyFile - key file from asymmetric for digital sign verification
        Returns:
        boolean value stating the digital signature verification is true or false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any of the required file is missing which contains digital sign verification information.

      • verifyK

        boolean verifyK()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        verifyK method helps to verify if the 3 types of key value generated before and after activation request is the same data or not.
        Returns:
        boolean value to check / verify if keys are same for a given machine
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - generally if mentioned files are missing in folder path

      • verifyPnPmData

        boolean verifyPnPmData()
                throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        verifyPnPmData method is one of the 3 levels of verification done , it basically checks the value created using encryption for machine ID using that specific key is same as the data created with same key after Activation key is passed on to user.
        Returns:
        boolean value showing if the verification is Pass or Fail
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if required files are missing

      • getPublic

        private java.security.PublicKey getPublic(java.lang.String filename)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
